column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=— Robert Cailliau
#Text=Tim , who had a longer experience with the internet world , convinced me that the web could only survive if all the code was freely available for everyone who wanted to tinker with it .
#Text=I then worked patiently for some 6 months with CERN 's Legal Service to draft a document that put the source code into the public domain .
#Text=This also implied working to convince the management , up to the Directors , of the need to do so .
#Text=The result was the document signed on 30 April 1993 that gave the WWW technology to the world .
#Text=During the same period I also perceived that the web as a technology had very many aspects .

#Text=Tim drew what he called the " metro " : a diagram of the relationships between the existing systems ( FTP , SMTP , HTTP , ... ) in the form of a stylised map resembling that of the London Underground .
#Text=That made me think that we needed to deal with a lot more hard computer science than our small team of four or five could intellectually handle .
#Text=Therefore I began to toy with the idea of an international conference on WWW technologies .
#Text=Tim was not convinced , but I went ahead .
#Text=NCSA ( the National Center for Supercomputer Applications in the U.S. ) had just released Mosaic , first for the X-Window / Unix systems , then for Mac and PC .
#Text=Their group not only had a lot more people , but their leader , Joseph Hardin , was a sociologist of my age .

#Text=I suspected that he was thinking along the same lines , and I was right : when I launched the call for papers for the first WWW conference in December 1993 , I did so just one day before NCSA would have done the same thing .
#Text=It was a Friday and on Saturday Hardin phoned me at home to discuss the matter .
#Text=Fortunately our relations were good and he was also very fair by teaming up with my conference in the end .
#Text=But our team at the time was very weak : NCSA had a big success with Mosaic and they could easily have used their weight to wipe us off the map .
#Text=It was also a time to understand how underdeveloped our idea of Europe here is .
#Text=We know that we have to live together on this assembly of peninsulas , but when we have to pull in the same direction then that is politically rather difficult .
#Text=Finally for two years I worked quite hard contributing to the setting up of the Web Consortium .
#Text=Even afterwards that took much effort and a lot of my time .
#Text=Wikinews :
#Text=There are some fun anecdotes about the beginning of the World Wide Web .
#Text=We 've just offered you a virtual beer , but the idea of the WWW started with a beer too , in this case with a ( real ) beer with Tim Berners-Lee , right ?
#Text=And there is a reason that the original WWW-logo is green , right ?
#Text=Why is it not called world-wide web , with a hyphen ?
#Text=Are there other anecdotes you want to share with our readers ?
